channel.title: Running the software without the board
channel.description: I just installed the your software on linux to see how it works before I buy an Axoliti, but I can't get any sound out of it, do I need to have a board connected in order to do so?

item.title: Running the software without the board
item.dc:creator: @Positonic James
item.description:
@Positonic wrote:

Ok, my misunderstanding, I have a board now yay

Read full topic
item.source: Running the software without the board

item.title: Running the software without the board
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

While an emulator integrated into the patcher might be nice, it would be a lot of work for a fairly limited practical use. The patcher isn't meant to be a standalone piece of software, it's only supposed to be of use to people with an Axoloti board.

Read full topic
item.source: Running the software without the board

item.title: Running the software without the board
item.dc:creator: @dreamer
item.description:
@dreamer wrote:

The software programs (and can control - as midi interface) the board.

You can build and compile patches, but ALL sound is generated by the axoloti core.

Read full topic
item.source: Running the software without the board

item.title: Running the software without the board
item.dc:creator: @JeromeB
item.description:
@JeromeB wrote:

Yes, the software is only used to program the axoloti core board.

Read full topic
item.source: Running the software without the board
